required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparation of Proseal Laryngeal Mask Airway With Flexible Laryngeal Airway Mask
clinical_study.official_title: Comparation of Efficacy and Safety of Proseal Laryngeal Mask Airway With Flexible Laryngeal Airway Mask in Otitis Media Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Eye & ENT Hospital of Fudan University

clinical_study.source: Eye & ENT Hospital of Fudan University

brief_summary.textblock: Objective To investigate the comparative effect of proseal laryngeal mask airway and flexible laryngeal airway mask during otitis media surgery. Methods 200 patients of ASA I or II classification, 18-65 years old, BMI<30 kg/m2 undergoing otitis media surgery are randomly divided into two groups (Group P with proseal laryngeal mask airway and Group F with flexible laryngeal airway mask, respectively). After induction, selecting a appropriate size of LMA to patient,s weight, using the standard index finger-guided technique inserting the LMA, and then the patients were ventilated mechanically. The success rate of inserting laryngeal mask, the intubation time, surgery time and wake time were also recorded. Tidal volume and leakage pressure in patients with supine and lateral positioning were assessed respectively. The scale of fiberoptic bronchoscopy was also recorded to show airway exposure. Related complications such as sore throat, hoarseness, cough, laryngospasm, bloating, nausea and vomiting, soft tissue injury, blood residue after pulling out the LMA were analyzed.Postoperative voice and laryngopharyngeal symptom are also recorded.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: success rate of inserting laryngeal mask
tidal volume at 15cmH2O in patients with supine and lateral positioning
leakage pressure in patients with supine and lateral positioning
1 = only vocal cords visible; 2 = vocal cords plus posterior epiglottis visible; 3 = vocal cords plus anterior epiglottis visible; and 4 = vocal cords invisible

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with cranial nerve injury
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with cranial nerve injury

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with sore throat
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with sore throat

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with soft tissue injury
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with soft tissue injury

intervention.description: Ventilation with flexible laryngeal mask airway
Ventilation with proseal laryngeal mask airway

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Clinical diagnosis of otitis media.
Exclusion Criteria:
Problems with the upper airway. Gastric carcinoma. Reflux esophagitis.
